page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT IN BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: A large majority of the people living in this survey area are retired. The area used to be agricultural with much of the population employed on farms, but increasing mechanisation has changed this and there are now only 25 people employed on local farms. Westgate farm employs two people on the{Youth {Training Scheme}. After the farms, the next major employers are the surgery, which employs twelve people, and the garage, which has six employees. Several people from this survey area work in local shops. King's Lynn and Fakenham are the nearest{industrial centres}and people from Burnham Market commute to work at both places. A mobile{Job Centre}visits the village fortnightly: unemployment in this part of Norfolk is currently 13%.
